title: Three teens sought in Toronto stabbings
content:
TORONTO - Police are seeking three teens in a weekend stabbing in downtown Toronto. 
 

                            Police say two girls and a boy went into a Yonge Street store Saturday afternoon and stole a number of items. 
 

                            They say two employees chased the fleeing teens and caught up with them when one of the girls allegedly stabbed both workers with a knife. 
 

                            The girl with the knife is believed to be 15 years old and described as roughly five feet six inches tall and 155 pounds with a medium build. 
 

                            The second girl is described as between 13 and 15 years old, about five feet two inches tall with a thin build and dark hair. 
 

                            The boy is described as five feet seven inches tall, about 115 pounds, with a thin build and red hair. His age isn't specified. 
 

                            By The Canadian Press
